Class TableUtil

Object
TableUtil
public class TableUtil extends Object
Utility for rendering formatted CLI tables with pagination support. Used to display projects, enquiries, and applications in a tabular format. Also handles ANSI-safe printing and formatting options.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Javier

  • Method Details

    • stripAnsi

      private static String stripAnsi(String input)
      Removes ANSI escape codes from a string to compute correct length for formatting.
      Parameters:
      input - The string possibly containing ANSI codes.
      Returns:
      The plain string with ANSI codes removed.

    • printTable

      public static void printTable(List<String> headers, List<List<String>> rows)
      Displays a paginated, formatted table using the given headers and row data. Automatically adjusts column widths and supports ANSI coloring.
      Parameters:
      headers - The list of column headers.
      rows - The row data, where each row is a list of strings.

    • printProjectTable

      public static void printProjectTable(List<Project> projects, Applicant applicant, Filter filter)
      Displays a filtered table of available projects for an applicant. Filters by flat type, price range, and applicant eligibility.
      Parameters:
      projects - The list of projects to display.
      applicant - The applicant viewing the projects.
      filter - Optional filter to apply.

    • printProjectTable

      public static void printProjectTable(List<Project> projects, Filter filter)
      Displays a filtered table of all projects for managers and officers. Shows flat types, visibility, assigned officers, and slot availability.
      Parameters:
      projects - The list of projects to display.
      filter - Optional filter to apply.

    • printEnquiryTable

      public static void printEnquiryTable(List<Enquiry> enquiries)
      Displays a table of enquiries submitted by users, showing message previews, reply status, and project information.
      Parameters:
      enquiries - The list of enquiries to display.
